meanings.definition: To bring to a common center; to concentrate.
meanings.sent1: She concentered all her energy on finishing the puzzle.
meanings.sent2: The students concentered their efforts on studying for the exam.
meanings.sent3: The chef concentered all his attention on perfecting the recipe.
meanings.sent4: The artist concentered her creativity on painting a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The team concentered their focus on winning the championship game.

meanings.definition: To focus or direct towards a central point.
meanings.sent1: He concentered his thoughts on finding a solution to the problem.
meanings.sent2: The speaker concentered her speech on the importance of education.
meanings.sent3: The detective concentered his investigation on solving the mystery.
meanings.sent4: The coach concentered his strategy on winning the match.
meanings.sent5: The scientist concentered her research on discovering a cure.

meanings.definition: Concentrated or focused at a central point.
meanings.sent1: The concentered beam of light illuminated the room.
meanings.sent2: Her concentered gaze never wavered from the target.
meanings.sent3: The concentered effort of the team led to victory.
meanings.sent4: The concentered sound of the bell echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The concentered design of the building drew attention from afar.
